title: This should be obvious... but it seems not...
body:
if someone is caught out alone, surrounded by 4 enemies, while being trapped in a Morgana Q with a leona or blitz standing there just waiting for that snare to finish, they already know they are in trouble, and that 'danger' ping you just hit them with really doesn't give them any new information.

But more importantly! Spamming it at them while they are snared/stunned ISNT (contrary to popular belief) going to help them escape. In truth they are not going to escape because not even Batman could escape from that. 

So telling them that theres danger around whilst they're being pummelled by 4 champs in an unescapable situation.... 

actually. 

does. 

nothing!

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

replies.body:
I know your pain so much. Multiple pings are just a nuisance and at times if spammed frequently actually blind me to what is happening,...

Just ping once, seriously, you don't have to ping me 5 freaking times.
By the time it matters its a _boy who pinged wolf_ situation and no one knows who to trust. {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}

Or when I go 1v1 with a champ and someone decides to ping me to warn me that they THINK I wont be able to win the fight, even though I am sure I have more experience on Yi than that person.

PInging me for no reason tilts me!!!

Oh no, it does something.

It FARKING PISSES ME OFF!

I think of it as a 'wtf are you doing' ping.

i refuse to believe that they think it's their duty to inform my brain that I am in a bad situation.

I agree, although the people who do it are just frustrated when allies get caught out.
So it's not really a "I'M HELPING!" thing, as much as it's a "VENTING MY ANGER" thing.

Honestly, implementing a ping muting feature was not done due to the fact that pings are helpful communication tools. Although, I've found that some players only use pings to annoy others and never actually use it to communicate with the team.

I've had junglers get counter-jungled and start a fight with the enemy without notifying the team. After they die they spam pings at their location and complain that the team won't help. 

Sure players should have map awareness, but we all have moments of tunnel visioning in lane when facing tough enemies. Pinging doesn't ensure your allies will respond, but it will make sure they can either warn you to run because they're busy or more often than not, they will respond.
how many smurfs did you upvote yourself on...
